title: How to Make Rainbow Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Prepare the oven and tray.
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 176 degrees Celsius. Cover a baking tray with parchment paper or spray non-stick greasing spray on it.

steps.headline: Combine the flour, baking soda, and cornstarch with a whisk.
steps.description: Stir until the dry ingredients are mixed properly.

steps.headline: Cream the butter, sugar, vanilla, and pudding mix.
steps.description: In a large bowl cream the butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and the pudding mix using a hand or electric blender. Cream the ingredients until they are light and fluffy and there are no butter clumps. Crack the eggs in, one at a time. Blend again until there are no egg streaks. You can also use a whisk to cream the mixture but do note it may take longer.

steps.headline: Add the flour mixture.
steps.description: Pour in the flour mixture and blend on low speed to avoid flour spilling out. Keep blending until the dough forms and gets slightly sticky.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips and blend again until combined well.
steps.description: Take caution not to over-mix the cookie dough. Over-mixing will cause the cookies to become greasy and have a darker color.

steps.headline: Separate the cookie dough.
steps.description: In four different plastic containers, separate the cookie dough into four equally sized pieces. Add 5 drops of food coloring gel to the first container and mix using a wooden spoon until the color reveals itself. Repeat the process again using the other 3 colors.

steps.headline: Place the cookie dough on the baking tray using a mini ice cream scoop.
steps.description: Continue until there is no more dough.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies.
steps.description: Place the chocolate chip cookies in the hot oven to bake for about 7-10 minutes. The cookies should be done when the edges are lightly browned and the cookies slightly 'puff' up.

steps.headline: Let the cookies cool.
steps.description: Remove the cookies from the oven. Using a spatula, carefully place the cookies on a wire rack to cool for about 5 minutes.

Combine the flour, baking soda, and cornstarch with a whisk. Stir until the dry ingredients are mixed properly. Cream the butter, sugar, vanilla, and pudding mix. In a large bowl cream the butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and the pudding mix using a hand or electric blender. Cream the ingredients until they are light and fluffy and there are no butter clumps. Crack the eggs in, one at a time. Blend again until there are no egg streaks. You can also use a whisk to cream the mixture but do note it may take longer. Add the flour mixture. Pour in the flour mixture and blend on low speed to avoid flour spilling out. Keep blending until the dough forms and gets slightly sticky. Add the chocolate chips and blend again until combined well. Take caution not to over-mix the cookie dough. Over-mixing will cause the cookies to become greasy and have a darker color. Separate the cookie dough. In four different plastic containers, separate the cookie dough into four equally sized pieces. Add 5 drops of food coloring gel to the first container and mix using a wooden spoon until the color reveals itself. Repeat the process again using the other 3 colors. Place the cookie dough on the baking tray using a mini ice cream scoop. Continue until there is no more dough. Bake the cookies. Place the chocolate chip cookies in the hot oven to bake for about 7-10 minutes. The cookies should be done when the edges are lightly browned and the cookies slightly 'puff' up. Let the cookies cool. Remove the cookies from the oven. Using a spatula, carefully place the cookies on a wire rack to cool for about 5 minutes. Serve and enjoy!
